Sentencas: Lanthanum zirconate (LZO) formation and growth kinetics between 1273-1673 K at the A-site (La, Sr)-deficient Sr-doped lanthanum manganite (LSM)/yttrium-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) interface were studied using high-resolution transmission electron microscopy-energy-dispersive X-ray spectrometry (HRTEM-EDS).
Titulo: Characterization of lanthanum zirconate formation at the A-site-deficient strontium-doped lanthanum manganite cathode/yttrium-stabilized zirconia electrolyte interface of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A cross-section TEM sample preparation technique was developed using a dual-beam focused ion beam and an in situ Omniprobe manipulator.
Titulo: Characterization of lanthanum zirconate formation at the A-site-deficient strontium-doped lanthanum manganite cathode/yttrium-stabilized zirconia electrolyte interface of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The LZO pyrochlore phase was identified at the LSM/YSZ interface by TEM.
Titulo: Characterization of lanthanum zirconate formation at the A-site-deficient strontium-doped lanthanum manganite cathode/yttrium-stabilized zirconia electrolyte interface of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The LZO is epitaxial with respect to the YSZ phase but not to the LSM phase.
Titulo: Characterization of lanthanum zirconate formation at the A-site-deficient strontium-doped lanthanum manganite cathode/yttrium-stabilized zirconia electrolyte interface of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: EDS results coupled with structural analysis suggest that La diffusion is a critical step in LZO formation.
Titulo: Characterization of lanthanum zirconate formation at the A-site-deficient strontium-doped lanthanum manganite cathode/yttrium-stabilized zirconia electrolyte interface of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This study shows that LZO formation can occur even for A-site-deficient LSM with a La composition of 78 mol% (< 86 mol%).
Titulo: Characterization of lanthanum zirconate formation at the A-site-deficient strontium-doped lanthanum manganite cathode/yttrium-stabilized zirconia electrolyte interface of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The activation energy for LZO formation was found to be 168 +/- 8 KJ/mol.
Titulo: Characterization of lanthanum zirconate formation at the A-site-deficient strontium-doped lanthanum manganite cathode/yttrium-stabilized zirconia electrolyte interface of solid oxide fuel cells
